profileText: a Representative from New York; born in Manhattan, New York County, N.Y., November 11, 1980; graduated from New Dorp High School, Staten Island, N.Y., 1998; B.A., Seton Hall University, South Orange, N.J., 2001; M.B.A., Wagner University, Staten Island, N.Y., 2010; staff, New York Governor George Pataki, 2004–2006; public relations professional; member of the New York state assembly, 2011–2020; presidential campaign aide, United States Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, 2015-2016; unsuccessful candidate for election as Mayor of New York, N.Y., in 2017; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventeenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2021–present).
